name: Intervened Monoprint A3 Palm and Parasol Number 1
description: Based on a physical work that belongs to a series of 50 + works. This landscape devoid of people, suggest the calm of holidays, wish-for peace and escapism. This work and the others in the series appeared as I adapted to the pandemic restrictions of time and space, as a working artist and mother of young kids. I swapped my oil and their usually slow process for gel plates, stencils, acrylic and spray paints, in order to get a bulk of prep works to intervened at home. This work is effectively art from the pandemic. This series depict landscapes that use figurative, recognizable elements spray painted,  placed as in a collage over a unplanned background, a gel plate monoprint using acrylic paint and stencils.
